es.uned.lsi.compiler.intermediate
Class IntermediateCodeBuilder

java.lang.Object
  es.uned.lsi.compiler.intermediate.IntermediateCodeBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
IntermediateCodeBuilderIF
public class IntermediateCodeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements IntermediateCodeBuilderIF

Class for IntermediateCodeBuilder. Code Builders aids programmer to generate sequences of quadruples. Firstly, addQuadruple methods are used to accumulate a set of instructions. Then, create method return all fresh created quadruples as a sequence in a List.

addQuadruple

public final void addQuadruple(java.lang.String operation,
                               java.lang.Object result,
                               java.lang.Object first,
                               java.lang.Object second)
Adds a quadruple to the intermediate code. first, second and result parameters may be an instance of OperandIF or a name (String) referencing a variable, temporal or label. In these latter cases remember that:
  • If name starts with the prefix in TEMPORAL_PREFIX, a TemporalIF object will be created.
  • If name starts with the prefix in LABEL_PREFIX, a LabelIF object will be created.
  • otherwise, a VariableIF object will be created.

Specified by:
addQuadruple in interface IntermediateCodeBuilderIF
Parameters:
operation - The operation.
first - The first operand.
second - The second operand.
result - The result.
